verses.verse: And He entered <WG1525> and was passing <WG1330> through <WG1330> Jericho. <WG2410>
And behold, <WG2400> there was a man <WG435> called <WG2564> by the name <WG3686> of Zaccheus; <WG2195> and he was a chief <WG754> tax-gatherer, and he was rich. <WG4145>
And he was trying <WG2212> to see <WG3708> who <WG5101> Jesus <WG2424> was, and he was unable <WG3756> <WG1410> because <WG575> of the crowd, <WG3793> for he was small <WG3398> in stature. <WG2244>

And he ran <WG4390> on ahead <WG1715> and climbed <WG305> up into a sycamore <WG4809> tree <WG4809> in order <WG2443> to see <WG3708> Him, for He was about <WG3195> to pass <WG1330> through <WG1330> that way.

And when <WG5613> Jesus <WG2424> came <WG2064> to the place, <WG5117> He looked <WG308> up and said <WG3004> to him, "Zaccheus, <WG2195> hurry <WG4692> and come <WG2597> down, <WG2597> for today <WG4594> I must <WG1163> stay <WG3306> at your house. <WG3624>"
And he hurried <WG4692> and came <WG2597> down, <WG2597> and received <WG5264> Him gladly. <WG5463>
And when they saw <WG3708> it, they all <WG3956> [began] to grumble, <WG1234> saying, <WG3004> "He has gone <WG1525> to be the guest <WG2647> of a man <WG435> who is a sinner. <WG268>"

And Zaccheus <WG2195> stopped <WG2476> and said <WG3004> to the Lord, <WG2962> "Behold, <WG2400> Lord, <WG2962> half <WG2255> of my possessions <WG5225> I will give <WG1325> to the poor, <WG4434> and if <WG1487> I have defrauded <WG4811> anyone <WG5100> of anything, <WG5100> I will give <WG591> back <WG591> four <WG5073> times <WG5073> as much. <WG5073>"
And Jesus <WG2424> said <WG3004> to him, "Today <WG4594> salvation <WG4991> has come <WG1096> to this <WG3778> house, <WG3624> because <WG2530> he, too, <WG2532> is a son <WG5207> of Abraham. <WG11>
"For the Son <WG5207> of Man <WG444> has come <WG2064> to seek <WG2212> and to save <WG4982> that which was lost. <WG622>"

And while they were listening <WG191> to these <WG3778> things, <WG3778> He went <WG4369> on to tell <WG3004> a parable, <WG3850> because <WG1223> He was near <WG1451> Jerusalem, <WG2419> and they supposed <WG1380> that the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> was going <WG3195> to appear <WG398> immediately. <WG3916>

He said <WG3004> therefore, <WG3767> "A certain <WG5100> nobleman <WG2104> <WG444> went <WG4198> to a distant <WG3117> country <WG5561> to receive <WG2983> a kingdom <WG932> for himself, <WG1438> and [then] return. <WG5290>

"And he called <WG2564> ten <WG1176> of his slaves, <WG1401> and gave <WG1325> them ten <WG1176> minas, <WG3414> and said <WG3004> to them, 'Do <WG4231> business <WG4231> [with this] until <WG1722> <WG3739> I come <WG2064> [back.]'

"But his citizens <WG4177> hated <WG3404> him, and sent <WG649> a delegation <WG4242> after <WG3694> him, saying, <WG3004> 'We do not want <WG2309> this <WG3778> man <WG3778> to reign <WG936> over <WG1909> us.'

"And it came <WG1096> about that when <WG1722> he returned, <WG1880> after receiving <WG2983> the kingdom, <WG932> he ordered <WG3004> that these <WG3778> slaves, <WG1401> to whom <WG3739> he had given <WG1325> the money, <WG694> be called <WG5455> to him in order <WG2443> that he might know <WG1097> what <WG5101> business <WG1281> they had done. <WG1281>
"And the first <WG4413> appeared, <WG3854> saying, <WG3004> 'Master, <WG2962> your mina <WG3414> has made <WG4333> ten <WG1176> minas <WG3414> more. <WG4333>'

"And he said <WG3004> to him, 'Well <WG1065> <WG2095> done, <WG2095> good <WG18> slave, <WG1401> because <WG3754> you have been <WG1096> faithful <WG4103> in a very <WG1646> little <WG1646> thing, <WG1646> be in authority <WG1849> over <WG1883> ten <WG1176> cities. <WG4172>'
"And the second <WG1208> came, <WG2064> saying, <WG3004> 'Your mina, <WG3414> master, <WG2962> has made <WG4160> five <WG4002> minas. <WG3414>'
"And he said <WG3004> to him also, <WG2532> 'And you are to be over <WG1883> five <WG4002> cities. <WG4172>'
"And another <WG2087> came, <WG2064> saying, <WG3004> 'Master, <WG2962> behold <WG2400> your mina, <WG3414> which <WG3739> I kept <WG2192> put <WG606> away <WG606> in a handkerchief; <WG4676>

for I was afraid <WG5399> of you, because <WG3754> you are an exacting <WG840> man; <WG444> you take <WG142> up what <WG3739> you did not lay <WG5087> down, <WG5087> and reap <WG2325> what <WG3739> you did not sow. <WG4687>'

"He said <WG3004> to him, 'By your own words <WG4750> I will judge <WG2919> you, you worthless <WG4190> slave. <WG1401> Did you know <WG3609> that I am <WG1510> an exacting <WG840> man, <WG444> taking <WG142> up what <WG3739> I did not lay <WG5087> down, <WG5087> and reaping <WG2325> what <WG3739> I did not sow <WG4687>?
'Then <WG2532> why <WG1223> <WG5101> did you not put <WG1325> the money <WG694> in the bank, <WG5132> and having come, <WG2064> I would have collected <WG4238> it with interest <WG5110>?'
"And he said <WG3004> to the bystanders, <WG3936> 'Take <WG142> the mina <WG3414> away <WG142> from him, and give <WG1325> it to the one who has <WG2192> the ten <WG1176> minas. <WG3414>'
"And they said <WG3004> to him, 'Master, <WG2962> he has <WG2192> ten <WG1176> minas <WG3414> [already.]'

"I tell <WG3004> you, that to everyone <WG3956> who has <WG2192> shall [more] be given, <WG1325> but from the one who does not have, <WG2192> even <WG2532> what <WG3739> he does have <WG2192> shall be taken <WG142> away. <WG142>

"But these <WG3778> enemies <WG2190> of mine, <WG1473> who did not want <WG2309> me to reign <WG936> over <WG1909> them, bring <WG71> them here <WG5602> and slay <WG2695> them in my presence. <WG1715>"
And after He had said <WG3004> these <WG3778> things, <WG3778> He was going <WG4198> on ahead, <WG1715> ascending <WG305> to Jerusalem. <WG2414>

And it came <WG1096> about that when <WG5613> He approached <WG1448> Bethphage <WG967> and Bethany, <WG963> near <WG4314> the mount <WG3735> that is called <WG2564> Olivet, <WG1638> He sent <WG649> two <WG1417> of the disciples, <WG3101>

saying, <WG3004> "Go <WG5217> into the village <WG2968> opposite <WG2713> [you,] in which <WG3739> as you enter <WG1531> you will find <WG2147> a colt <WG4454> tied, <WG1210> on which <WG3739> no <WG3762> one <WG444> <WG3762> yet <WG4455> has ever <WG4455> sat; <WG2523> untie <WG3089> it, and bring <WG71> it [here.]
"And if <WG1437> anyone <WG5100> asks <WG2065> you, 'Why <WG1223> <WG5101> are you untying <WG3089> it?' thus <WG3779> shall you speak, <WG3004> 'The Lord <WG2962> has <WG2192> need <WG5532> of it.'"
And those <WG3588> who were sent <WG649> went <WG565> away <WG565> and found <WG2147> it just <WG2531> as He had told <WG3004> them.
And as they were untying <WG3089> the colt, <WG4454> its owners <WG2962> said <WG3004> to them, "Why <WG5101> are you untying <WG3089> the colt <WG4454>?"
And they said, <WG3004> "The Lord <WG2962> has <WG2192> need <WG5532> of it."
And they brought <WG71> it to Jesus, <WG2424> and they threw <WG1977> their garments <WG2440> on the colt, <WG4454> and put <WG1913> Jesus <WG2424> [on it.]
And as He was going, <WG4198> they were spreading <WG5291> their garments <WG2440> in the road. <WG3598>

And as He was now <WG2235> approaching, <WG1448> near <WG4314> the descent <WG2600> of the Mount <WG3735> of Olives, <WG1636> the whole <WG537> multitude <WG4128> of the disciples <WG3101> began <WG757> to praise <WG134> God <WG2316> joyfully <WG5463> with a loud <WG3173> voice <WG5456> for all <WG3956> the miracles <WG1411> which <WG3739> they had seen, <WG3708>
saying, <WG3004> "Blessed <WG2127> is the King <WG935> who comes <WG2064> in the name <WG3686> of the Lord; <WG2962> Peace <WG1515> in heaven <WG3772> and glory <WG1391> in the highest! <WG5310>"
And some <WG5100> of the Pharisees <WG5330> in the multitude <WG3793> said <WG3004> to Him, "Teacher, <WG1320> rebuke <WG2008> Your disciples. <WG3101>"
And He answered <WG611> and said, <WG3004> "I tell <WG3004> you, if <WG1437> these <WG3778> become <WG4623> silent, <WG4623> the stones <WG3037> will cry <WG2896> out!"
And when <WG5613> He approached, <WG1448> He saw <WG3708> the city <WG4172> and wept <WG2799> over <WG1909> it,

saying, <WG3004> "If <WG1487> you had known <WG1097> in this <WG3778> day, <WG2250> even <WG2532> you, the things which make for peace! <WG1515> But now <WG3568> they have been hidden <WG2928> from your eyes. <WG3788>

"For the days <WG2250> shall come <WG2240> upon you when <WG2532> your enemies <WG2190> will throw <WG3925> up a bank <WG5482> before you, and surround <WG4033> you, and hem <WG4912> you in on every <WG3840> side, <WG3840>

and will level <WG1474> you to the ground <WG1474> and your children <WG5043> within <WG1722> you, and they will not leave <WG863> in you one stone <WG3037> upon another, <WG3037> because <WG473> <WG3739> you did not recognize <WG1097> the time <WG2540> of your visitation. <WG1984> "
And He entered <WG1525> the temple <WG2413> and began <WG757> to cast <WG1544> out those <WG3588> who were selling, <WG4453>
saying <WG3004> to them, " It is written, <WG1125> 'And My house <WG3624> shall be a house <WG3624> of prayer, <WG4335>' but you have made <WG4160> it a robbers' den. <WG4693>"

And He was teaching <WG1321> daily <WG2596> <WG2250> in the temple; <WG2413> but the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and the scribes <WG1122> and the leading <WG4413> men <WG4413> among the people <WG2992> were trying <WG2212> to destroy <WG622> Him,
and they could not find <WG2147> anything <WG5101> that they might do, <WG4160> for all <WG537> the people <WG2992> were hanging <WG1582> upon His words. <WG191>
